questions.question: Stuck -at-0 or Stuck-at-1 is type of resistance in a circuit?

explanations.b: 'Stuck-at-0' or 'Stuck-at-1' faults are logical errors where a signal remains fixed, unrelated to resistance or physical issues in the circuit. /A stuck-at-0 or stuck-at-1 fault is not a type of resistance fault - it is a logical fault model used in digital circuits.

questions.question: Which logic gate is described by the statement: 'Must have one or the other, but not both'?

explanations.c: The statement 'Must have one or the other, but not both' describes the behavior of an XOR (Exclusive OR) gate, which outputs 1 only when exactly one of its inputs is 1 - not both.

questions.question: For an XOR gate with three or more input variables, the output will be 1 _____________________________ .

answers.a: If an even number of variables must be equal to 1
answers.b: If an odd number of variables must be equal to 1
answers.d: We can not determine with the given data

explanations.b: The XOR (exclusive OR) gate outputs 1 only when the number of inputs that are 1 is odd. This holds true whether there are 2 inputs, 3, or more. So for 3 or more inputs, the XOR gate still outputs 1 if the count of 1s among the inputs is odd.

questions.question: Which of the following Boolean expressions correctly represents the logic function of a 2-input XOR (Exclusive OR) gate?

explanations.a: The XOR gate outputs high (1) when the inputs are different. The Boolean expression A'B + AB' captures this behavior, as it represents the sum of the conditions where only one input is high.
